title: 10 things to do in Helsinki
text:
10 things to do in Helsinki 10 things to do in Helsinki THE CAPITAL and largest city of Finland has a lot to offer for a colourful and exciting summer city break. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01, Sat, Jul 11, 2015 GETTY Take a trip on the Sparakoff, Helsinki’s pub tram 
1. Take a trip on the Sparakoff, Helsinki’s pub tram; it takes an hour to trundle past the main sights, serving beer on board as it does ( koff.net ). 
2. Head to the 72m high Olympic Stadium Tower (the city hosted the Olympics in 1952) for amazing views over the city. 
3. Browse the brightly-coloured fabrics, clothes and accessories at a Marimekko store; the classic Finnish textile design company has been going since 1951. 
4. Meet Havis Amanda, Helsinki’s answer to the Little Mermaid; a nude, bronze statue of a mermaid situated in the centre of a fountain in Market Square. 
5. Pop into the traditional Kauppahalli (Market Hall) to browse the food stalls selling local fare such as reindeer salami and salmon and potato soup. SAT MAG Traditional potato soup 
6. Try some salmiakki; this salty black liquorice is a favourite with Finns, but is rather an acquired taste… 
7. Visit the iconic, steel Sibelius monument at Sibelius Park, which honours Finland’s greatest classical composer. 
8. Gaze at the awe-inspiring, roughly hewn walls of the unique Temppeliaukio Church, built directly into solid rock (hence why it’s also known as the Rock Church). 
9. For all things Moomin, check out the Moomin Shop in the Forum mall off Mannerheimintie, in the city centre. From ties to chocolate, it’s got it all. 
10. Take a ride on the Finnair Skywheel, by the harbour, for spectacular sea views. Related articles
